programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: Nature at any price Bernard Cwiek has become a past master in the art of creating insect hotels perfectly adapted to garden wildlife. "Biodalism", or using any means necessary to bring more plants into towns and cities. Visiting the gardens of the Château de Kestellic. Don't panic: Valérie and Emwrick. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Kyrgyzstan, here we come From Zurich to Osh, in southern Kyrgyzstan. The team heads off to the foot of the Turkestan Range. A sparsely populated area that gives them a foretaste of the isolation they'll experience in the coming weeks. Directed by: Martin Schilt (Switzerland, 2020)

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
Grand-Lieu Lake
We head to the Maison du Lac with Fabrice, for a trip out on the water fishing for eels. Jean-Gabriel opens the doors to the Domaine des Hautes Noëlles wine estate. Exploring the trails around the Grand-Lieu Lake, discovering bird-watching and keeping a close eye on water quality.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Tales and legends of Haut-Doubs Once upon a time there was the Haut-Doubs, a land known for many tales, some of which are legendary. And when night falls, mysterious creatures invade the imaginations of Franche-Comté's inhabitants! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Gaîté-Lyrique. Encounter with Camille Moncomble, part-jeweller, part-poet, to discover a world recounted with fantasy and modernity. Exploring freemasonry. Focus on the textile artist Viviane Sagnier and her creations in sculpted wool, coloured in infinite shades of ivory. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.sub-title: De la science et des plantes
programme.desc: Of science and plants Élodie Carpentier, engineer and biotechnologist, has reinvented lipstick using exclusively organic, certified, patented products. What is the role of aquaporins in plants? Exploring the Brenne wetlands. Don't panic: Béatrice's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: No man's land After several days of walking, the team is en-route for the base camp in the Min Teke Valley. Suddenly the young women and their guide find themselves separated from their donkeys and their Kyrghyz drivers. They are completely alone, with neither tents nor signal. Directed by: Martin Schilt (Switzerland, 2020)

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Tonnerrois
We join Pascal in the Tonnerrois region for a visit to age-old vineyards that survived phylloxera. Bruno grows sunflowers and lentils the healthiest way possible in his fields. An in-depth look at current initiatives aimed at helping us better understand of the living world. All about Flogny-la-Chapelle gougères.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Tales and legends of Haut-Doubs Once upon a time there was the Haut-Doubs, a land known for many tales, some of which are legendary. And when night falls, mysterious creatures invade the imaginations of Franche-Comté's inhabitants! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Renaissance Château de Cadillac, Gironde. Encounter with the architect and designer Sophie Dries, for an enchanting journey to the heart of materials and know-how. A theatre-themed exploration of Paris. Focus on Mathon and its jewellers; craftsmen and women whose every gesture is precise and precious. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 5:

Spotlight on the paper creations by Marianne Guély. All you need to know about red heels. Working with wood, brass, leather, ivory and eggshell: an in-depth look at the craftsmanship of Atelier d'Art Walser. How to wear a Peter Pan collar. Mélissa Serror reinvents vintage jewellery with Sigal Paris.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Éric Pras (1/2)
Land of gastronomy and wine-growing par excellence, Burgundy immerses us in a wealth of taste and flavour, all accompanied by Éric Pras. Veritable ambassador for his region, the three Michelin-starred chef takes us on a voyage from Chagny to Dijon, in the footsteps of talented chefs and passionate producers.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as a couple aboard a yacht On the Gaspé Peninsula, Julien meets Marie-Pier and Adrien, two thirty-somethings who sold everything to buy a sailing boat and live on it full-time. They also set up a sailing school, La Belle Vie Sailing. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of an industrial building dedicated to artistic production: Les Frigos. Encounter with Coralie Marabelle, environmentally-friendly designer creating clothing that's 100% French. Out and about in search of places where the music is good for both eyes and ears. Focus on Anne de La Forge and her enamelwork. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc:
The legends of Mortain
We head off to explore Mortain and the Sée valley, from waterfalls, to forests, rocks and the famous Mortain mist. An officially listed "Station Verte" known for its mysterious landscapes, it's also a land of legends and folktales, of King Arthur, fairies, goblins and even the devil himself!
Presented by: Vincent Chatelain.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Pumpkin curry and pesto
To use up the remains of a Halloween pumpkin, Ricardo suggests two recipes to cook both flesh and seeds: a chicken and pumpkin curry and pumpkin seed pesto.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Marinated chilli peppers and stuffed sweet peppers Mathieu Cloutier marinates biquinho chilli peppers and prepares stuffed and bread-crumbed fried sweet peppers. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Geneviève and Éric, Estrie (Lawrenceville) Determined to leave everything to run a farm, Éric had his work cut out to persuade Geneviève to follow him with their three children. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: The Tales of Hoffmann After "Carmen" it is one of the most frequently-performed French operas in the world. "The Tales of Hoffmann", Jacques Offenbach's ultimate work, to a libretto by Jules Barbier, was created posthumously in February 1881. Robert Carsen was responsible for staging it in 2000. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Vivian, Ontario
Louis helps out a client whose problem takes the form of two orphaned foxes.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Delights from the Middle East We set off on a journey to the Middle East with Manal Drissi, Elkhana Talbi and Les Filles Fattoush, a Syrian food service, and take a detour via Lebanon with the family behind the Trip de Bouffe restaurant. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: An invitation to explore behind the scenes at the Villa Arnaga in Combo-les-Bains, built by Edmond Rostand. An elegant immersion in the world of the designer Valentine Gauthier. A journey through Paris to discover the best Portuguese addresses. Focus on the sculptor Franck Espagnet who gives new life to driftwood. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
